lead_paragraph: Two women in the advertising department accuse the chief executive of The Times and a vice president of race, age and gender bias.

headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Accuses 2 New York Times Executives of Bias
headline.main: Suit Accuses New York Times Executives of Bias

snippet: Two women in the advertising department accuse the chief executive of The Times and a vice president of race, age and gender bias.
abstract: Ernestine Grant and Marjorie Walker, black employees in New York Times' advertising department, file federal lawsuit against company, chief executive Mark Thompson and chief revenue officer Meredith Levien, accusing them of age, race and gender bias; Times calls suit 'entirely without merit' and says it will fight it in court.
